sub_components.description: An accessible title for the alert dialog.

sub_components.description: An accessible description for the alert dialog.

sub_components.description: Contains the alert dialog action buttons.

sub_components.description: The confirm/action button in the alert dialog.

sub_components.name: AlertDialogCancel
sub_components.description: The cancel button in the alert dialog.

examples.title: Confirmation dialog
examples.code:
<AlertDialog>
  <AlertDialogTrigger asChild>
    <Button variant="outline">Delete Account</Button>
  </AlertDialogTrigger>
  <AlertDialogContent>
    <AlertDialogHeader>
      <AlertDialogTitle>Are you absolutely sure?</AlertDialogTitle>
      <AlertDialogDescription>This action cannot be undone.</AlertDialogDescription>
    </AlertDialogHeader>
    <AlertDialogFooter>
      <AlertDialogCancel>Cancel</AlertDialogCancel>
      <AlertDialogAction>Continue</AlertDialogAction>
    </AlertDialogFooter>
  </AlertDialogContent>
</AlertDialog>

guidelines.description: AlertDialogContent must contain an AlertDialogTitle for accessibility
AlertDialogContent must contain an AlertDialogAction to let users dismiss the dialog
Use AlertDialog only for destructive/irreversible confirmations. For regular dialogs use Dialog
AlertDialogContent must include AlertDialogDescription for accessibility

guidelines.description: Use shadcn/ui components from the catalog instead of raw HTML elements when a matching component exists
Import shadcn components from @/components/ui/, not from third-party packages directly
Use CSS variables (design tokens) instead of hardcoded color/spacing values
TooltipProvider must be rendered at the application root when using Tooltip components
Every form input (Input, Textarea, Select, Checkbox, Switch, Slider, RadioGroup) should have an associated Label component
All Dialog, AlertDialog, and Sheet instances must contain a Title sub-component for screen reader accessibility
Use the asChild prop on Trigger components (DialogTrigger, DropdownMenuTrigger, etc.) to render your own element instead of the default button
Prefer defaultValue/defaultOpen over controlled state (value/open + onChange) unless programmatic control is needed
Use the cn() utility from @/lib/utils for conditional className merging instead of template literals
Use lucide-react for icons: import { IconName } from 'lucide-react'
Placeholders are not label replacements. Always use a Label component or aria-label for form inputs
